===Linux and GNU===
===Linux and GNU===
{{Main|GNU|Linux}}
{{Main|GNU|Linux}}

[[File:Ubuntu 10.04 LTS.png|300px|thumb|Ubuntu, a common desktop distribution of Linux]]
+
[[File:Ubuntu 10.04 LTS.png|300px|thumb|[[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], a common desktop distribution of Linux]]
Linux is the generic name for a UNIX like operating system that can be used on a wide range of devices from supercomputers to wristwatches. The Linux [[kernel]] is released under an open source license, so anyone can read and modify its code. It has been modified to run on a large variety of electronics. Although estimates suggest it is used on only 0.5-2% of all personal computers{{Citation needed|date=July 2010}}, it has been widely adopted for use in servers and embedded systems{{Citation needed|date=July 2010}} (such as cell phones). Linux has superseded Unix in most places{{Which?|date=July 2010}}, and is used on the 10 most powerful supercomputers in the world{{Citation needed|date=July 2010}}.

Although estimates suggest it is used on only 0.5-2% of all personal computers{{Citation needed|date=July 2010}}, it has been widely adopted for use in servers and embedded systems{{Citation needed|date=July 2010}} (such as cell phones). Linux has superseded Unix in most places{{Which?|date=July 2010}}, and is used on the 10 most powerful supercomputers in the world{{Citation needed|date=July 2010}}.
